page.title: 09Shopping
page.content: Walkern used to have a butcher's shop, a general store, a post-office, 3 bakeries, 2 shoe repairers, 2 sweet shops, a newsagent, a cycle shop & a blacksmith's forge but is now reduced to the first 3 plus a hairdresser. The resident village doctor, midwife & policeman have also disappeared. The village store, which also sells & delivers newspapers & has a general delivery service, is used by 84% of Walkern residents (92% use the PO), but the expansion of Stevenage with its many shops & supermarkets has had an adverse effect on the small rural shopkeeper. The community still enjoys a doorstep milk delivery. Ardeley no longer has a shop & the lack of this & a PO is of considerable concern in the village. Weekly shopping is often done in Stevenage, Hitchin or Letchworth, larger items from further afield.
